intro: Hemigraphis panayensis, commonly known as the Panay nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
